conformance.description: Submitted data begins 1978-12-01. Simulation was actually run from 1978-09-01 to allow spin up of configured fields like river water storage.

requirementsReference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called stc.027 in a experiment called 3.3 amip
requirementsReference.name: stc.027

deployment.description: The resources(deployment) on which this simulation ran

platformReference.description: Reference to a platform called IBM Power 6
platformReference.name: IBM Power 6

simulationRun.description: Main amip ensemble simulations. Dust tuning modified from HadGEM2-ES runs as a result of previous work indicating that HadGEM2-A did not suffer from SST biases to which the dust is very senstive. SST and sea-ice imposed from observations and other forcings are as defined for the historical experiment. Output includes CFMIP required variables. Although the submitted data starts from December 1978, the simulations were started from September 1978 to allow configured fields like river water storage time to spin up.

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a fileVariable called CO2_concentration_mmr in a dataObject called well_mixed_gas_CO2
dataSourceReference.name: CO2_concentration_mmr

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a componentProperty called well_mixed_gas_CO2 in a modelComponent called Atmosphere
dataSourceReference.name: well_mixed_gas_CO2

input.description: Annual CO2 concentrations were provided by CMIP5 in units of parts per million by volume (ppmv) whereas HadGEm2-ES requires atmospheric concentrations of CO2 in units of mass mixing ratio (mmr). A conversion factor of (44.0/28.964e6) was used to convert units.

dataSourceReference.name: well_mixed_gas_CO2

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a modelComponent called Atmosphere

dataSourceReference.name: CO2_concentration_mmr

dataSourceReference.name: well_mixed_gas_CO2

dataSourceReference.name: Atmosphere

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a fileVariable called CH4_concentration_mmr in a dataObject called well_mixed_gas_CH4
dataSourceReference.name: CH4_concentration_mmr

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a componentProperty called well_mixed_gas_CH4 in a modelComponent called Atmosphere
dataSourceReference.name: well_mixed_gas_CH4

input.description: In the model, only the surface CH4 concentration were forced to follow the prescribed trajectory, but CH4 concentrations above the surface were calculated interactively, and the full 3D field was then passed to the model's radiation scheme. As CH4 concentrations were only prescribed at the surface, CH4 in HadGEM2-ES above the surface is free to evolve a non-uniform structure and may differ from the prescribed, well-mixed historical concentrations. The impact of passing a full 3D CH4 field from UKCA to the radiation scheme rather than passing a uniform concentration everywhere was evaluated in a present-day atmosphere-only configuration of the HadGEM1 model (Johns et al., 2006; Martin et al., 2006). It was found to cool the extra-tropical stratosphere by 0.5-1.0 K, thereby reducing the warm temperature biases in the model (O'Connor et al., 2009).

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a dataObject called well_mixed_gas_CH4
dataSourceReference.name: well_mixed_gas_CH4

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a modelComponent called Atmosphere
dataSourceReference.name: Atmosphere

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a fileVariable called CH4_concentration_mmr in a dataObject called well_mixed_gas_CH4
dataSourceReference.name: CH4_concentration_mmr

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a componentProperty called well_mixed_gas_CH4 in a modelComponent called Atmosphere
dataSourceReference.name: well_mixed_gas_CH4

input.description: In the model, only the surface CH4 concentration were forced to follow the prescribed trajectory, but CH4 concentrations above the surface were calculated interactively, and the full 3D field was then passed to the model's radiation scheme. As CH4 concentrations were only prescribed at the surface, CH4 in HadGEM2-ES above the surface is free to evolve a non-uniform structure and may differ from the prescribed, well-mixed historical concentrations. The impact of passing a full 3D CH4 field from UKCA to the radiation scheme rather than passing a uniform concentration everywhere was evaluated in a present-day atmosphere-only configuration of the HadGEM1 model (Johns et al., 2006; Martin et al., 2006). It was found to cool the extra-tropical stratosphere by 0.5-1.0 K, thereby reducing the warm temperature biases in the model (O'Connor et al., 2009).

input.description: The CMIP5 equivalent concentrations of CFC12 and HFC134a were derived by simply summing the radiative forcing of individual species and assuming linearity of both concentration and radiative forcing for a single species and of additivity of multiple species.

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a fileVariable called Oz_concentration_mmr in a dataObject called well_mixed_gas_Ozone
dataSourceReference.name: Oz_concentration_mmr

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a componentProperty called well_mixed_gas_Ozone in a modelComponent called Atmosphere
dataSourceReference.name: well_mixed_gas_Ozone

input.description: Stratospheric and tropospheric ozone is prescribed as monthly zonal/height ancillary files taken from the CMIP5 recommended AC&C/SPARC ozone database. These data were horizontally interpolated onto the model N96 horizontal grid. Vertical interpolation was achieved by mapping the SPARC ozone data from pressure surfaces onto pressure surface equivalent levels corresponding to the models height-based grid. Near-surface missing data was replaced by overlying nearest neighbour non-missing data.

dataSourceReference.name: well_mixed_gas_Ozone

dataSourceReference.name: Oz_concentration_mmr

dataSourceReference.name: well_mixed_gas_Ozone

input.description: Stratospheric and tropospheric ozone is prescribed as monthly zonal/height ancillary files taken from the CMIP5 recommended AC&C/SPARC ozone database. These data were horizontally interpolated onto the model N96 horizontal grid. Vertical interpolation was achieved by mapping the SPARC ozone data from pressure surfaces onto pressure surface equivalent levels corresponding to the models height-based grid. Near-surface missing data was replaced by overlying nearest neighbour non-missing data.

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a fileVariable called stratospheric_optical_thickness in a dataObject called volcanic_optical_thickness
dataSourceReference.name: stratospheric_optical_thickness

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a componentProperty called volcanic aerosol in a modelComponent called Atmosphere
dataSourceReference.name: volcanic aerosol

input.description: Stratospheric aerosol concentrations due to volcanic eruptions are varied across four equal area latitudinal zones on a monthly timescale. The aerosol is distributed vertically above the tropopause such that the mass mixing ratio is constant across the levels. In this version of the model, volcanic aerosol is not related to, and does not interact with, other simulated aerosol behaviour. The dataset used for the historic period was monthly stratospheric optical depths, at 550nm, from 1850 to 2000 (Sato et al., 1993).Background aerosols concentrations are covered in the sulphur_dioxide_emissions input. HadGEM2-A does not treat any gases from volcanic sources as a climate forcing.

dataSourceReference.description: Reference to a dataObject called volcanic_optical_thickness
dataSourceReference.name: volcanic_optical_thickness

dataSourceReference.name: Atmosphere

input.description: Stratospheric aerosol concentrations due to volcanic eruptions are varied across four equal area latitudinal zones on a monthly timescale. The aerosol is distributed vertically above the tropopause such that the mass mixing ratio is constant across the levels. In this version of the model, volcanic aerosol is not related to, and does not interact with, other simulated aerosol behaviour. The dataset used for the historic period was monthly stratospheric optical depths, at 550nm, from 1850 to 2000 (Sato et al., 1993).Background aerosols concentrations are covered in the sulphur_dioxide_emissions input. HadGEM2-A does not treat any gases from volcanic sources as a climate forcing.

These distributions are presented as monthly 3D profiles that are constant for all simulated years.

standard.description: The QN_DRS value allows mapping from data files to metadata being exported from the metadata questionnaire, and contains the institution name, the model name on which the simulation was run, the experiment name to which the simulation conforms, the simulation level base rip value, and finally the given start year for the simulation. The format of the string will thus be: institute_model_experiment_rip_startyear. Also note, that in particular cases, i.e. decadal and noVolc exps, the start date and expdate may differ - this will occur in those cases where the simulation start date is 1st january but still refers to an experiment for the year before. - (see cmip5 experiment design document)
standard.name: QN_DRS

detail.description: Modified dust tuning for HadGEM2-A runs as a results from previous comparison with HadGEM2-ES runs had indicated that HadGEM2-A did not suffer from the SST biases to which the dust is sensitive.

modelReference.description: Reference to a modelComponent called HadGEM2-A
modelReference.name: HadGEM2-A

contactInfo.address: Met Office Hadley Centre, Fitzroy Road, Exeter, Devon, UK, EX1 3PB
Met Office Hadley Centre, Fitzroy Road, Exeter, Devon, UK, EX1 3PB

supportsReference.description: Reference to an Experiment called amip with experimentNumber 3.3
supportsReference.name: amip
